com.stormpath.sdk.account

Interface Account

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Auditable, Deletable, Extendable, Resource, Saveable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HttpImmutableAccount, ImmutableAccount

    public interface Account
extends Resource, Saveable, Deletable, Extendable, Auditable
    An Account is a unique identity within a Directory. Accounts within a Directory or Group mapped to an Application may log in to that Application.
    Since:
    0.1

    • Method Summary

      Returns a paginated list of the applications that the account may login to that match the specified query criteria.

      Returns the account's parent Directory (where the account is stored).

    • Method Detail

      • getUsername

        String getUsername()
        Returns the account's username, guaranteed to be unique for all accounts within a Directory. If you do not have need of a username, it is best to set the username to equal the getEmail().
        Returns:
        the account's username, guaranteed to be unique for all accounts within a Directory.

      • setUsername

        Account setUsername(String username)
        Sets the account's username, which must be unique among all other accounts within a Directory. If you do not have need of a username, it is best to set the username to equal the getEmail().

        An attempt to set a username that is in use when creating or saving the account will result in a Error

        Parameters:
        username - the account's username, which must be unique among all other accounts within a Directory.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getEmail

        String getEmail()
        Returns the account's email address, guaranteed to be unique for all accounts within a Directory.
        Returns:
        the account's email address, guaranteed to be unique for all accounts within a Directory.

      • setEmail

        Account setEmail(String email)
        Sets the account's email address, which must be unique among all other accounts within a Directory.

        An attempt to set an email that is in use when creating or saving the account will result in a Error

        Parameters:
        email - the account's email address, which must be unique among all other accounts within a Directory.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • setPassword

        Account setPassword(String password)
        Sets (changes) the account's password to the specified raw (plaintext) password. ONLY call this method if you legitimately want to set the account password directly. It is usually more advisable to use Stormpath's account password reset email workflow (when possible).

        After calling this method, you must call Saveable.save() to propagate the change to the Stormpath servers.

        Parameters:
        password - the account's new raw (plaintext) password.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getFullName

        String getFullName()
        Returns the account's 'full name', per Western cultural conventions.

        This is NOT a persistent/settable/queryable property. It is a convenience computed property combining the givenName (aka 'first name' in Western cultures) followed by the middleName (if any) followed by the surname (aka 'last name' in Western cultures).

        Returns:
        the account's 'full name', per Western cultural conventions.
        Since:
        0.8

      • getStatus

        AccountStatus getStatus()
        Returns the account's status. Accounts that are not ENABLED may not login to applications.
        Returns:
        the account's status.

      • setStatus

        Account setStatus(AccountStatus status)
        Sets the account's status. Accounts that are not ENABLED may not login to applications.
        Parameters:
        status - the account's status.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getGroups

        GroupList getGroups()
        Returns a paginated list of the account's assigned groups.

        Tip: If this list might be large, instead of iterating over all groups, it might be more convenient (and practical) to execute a search for one or more of the account's groups using the getGroups(com.stormpath.sdk.group.GroupCriteria) or getGroups(java.util.Map) methods instead of this one.

        Returns:
        a paginated list of all groups assigned to the Account.
        See Also:
        getGroups(com.stormpath.sdk.group.GroupCriteria), getGroups(java.util.Map)

      • getGroups

        GroupList getGroups(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
        Returns a paginated list of the account's assigned groups that match the specified query criteria.

        This method is mostly provided as a non-type-safe alternative to the getGroups(com.stormpath.sdk.group.GroupCriteria) method which might be useful in dynamic languages on the JVM (for example, with Groovy): 

         def groups = account.getGroups([description: '*foo*', orderBy: 'name desc', limit: 50])
        The query parameter names and values must be equal to those documented in the Stormpath REST API product guide.

        Each queryParams key/value pair will be converted to String name to String value pairs and appended to the resource URL as query parameters, for example: 

         .../accounts/accountId/groups?param1=value1¶m2=value2&...

        If in doubt, use getGroups(com.stormpath.sdk.group.GroupCriteria) as all possible query options are available via type-safe guarantees that can be auto-completed by most IDEs.
        Parameters:
        queryParams - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the account's groups that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        0.8

      • getGroups

        GroupList getGroups(GroupCriteria criteria)
        Returns a paginated list of the account's assigned groups that match the specified query criteria. The Groups utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL - most modern IDEs can auto-suggest and auto-complete as you type, allowing for an easy query-building experience. For example: 
         account.getGroups(Groups.where(
     Groups.description().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
     .and(Groups.name().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderByName()
     .orderByStatus().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        or, if you use static imports: 
         import static com.stormpath.sdk.group.Groups.*;

 ...

 account.getGroups(where(
      description().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
     .and(name().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderByName()
     .orderByStatus().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        Parameters:
        criteria - the criteria to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the account's groups that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        0.8

      • getDirectory

        Directory getDirectory()
        Returns the account's parent Directory (where the account is stored).
        Returns:
        the account's parent Directory (where the account is stored)

      • getTenant

        Tenant getTenant()
        Returns the Stormpath Tenant that owns this Account resource.
        Returns:
        the Stormpath Tenant that owns this Account resource.

      • getGroupMemberships

        GroupMembershipList getGroupMemberships()
        Returns all GroupMemberships that reflect this account. This method is an alternative to getGroups() that returns the actual association entity representing the account and a group.
        Since:
        0.4

      • addGroup

        GroupMembership addGroup(Group group)
        Assigns this account to the specified Group.

        Immediate Execution: Unlike other Account methods, you do not need to call Saveable.save() afterwards. This method will interact with the server immediately.

        Parameters:
        group - the Group this account will be added to
        Returns:
        the new GroupMembership resource created reflecting the account-to-group association.
        Since:
        0.4

      • addGroup

        GroupMembership addGroup(String hrefOrName)
        Assigns this account to the specified Group represented by its (case insensitive) name or href

        Immediate Execution: Unlike other Account methods, you do not need to call Saveable.save() afterwards. This method will persist the changes in the backend immediately.

        Parameters:
        hrefOrName - the href or name of the group to add.
        Returns:
        the new GroupMembership resource created reflecting the account-to-group association.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no Group matching hrefOrName could be found in this Account's directory.
        Since:
        1.0.RC5

      • removeGroup

        Account removeGroup(Group group)
        Removes this account from the specified Group.

        Immediate Execution: Unlike other Account methods, you do not need to call Saveable.save() afterwards. This method will persist the changes in the backend immediately.

        Parameters:
        group - the Group object from where the account must be removed.
        Returns:
        the Account object for method chaining
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this Account does not belong to the specified group.
        Since:
        1.0.RC5

      • removeGroup

        Account removeGroup(String hrefOrName)
        Removes this account from the specified Group represented by its (case insensitive) name or href .

        Immediate Execution: Unlike other Account methods, you do not need to call Saveable.save() afterwards. This method will persist the changes in the backend immediately.

        Parameters:
        hrefOrName - the href or name of the group to add.
        Returns:
        the Account object for method chaining
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this Account does not belong to the Group matching the given hrefOrName.
        Since:
        1.0.RC5

      • getEmailVerificationToken

        EmailVerificationToken getEmailVerificationToken()
        Returns the account's email verification token. This will only be non-null if the Account holder has been asked to verify their email account by clicking a link in an email.
        Returns:
        the account's email verification token.

      • saveWithResponseOptions

        Account saveWithResponseOptions(AccountOptions responseOptions)
        Saves this Account resource and ensures the returned Account response reflects the specified options. This enhances performance by 'piggybacking' the response to return related resources you know you will use after saving the account.
        Parameters:
        responseOptions - The AccountOptions to use to customize the Account resource returned in the save response.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.
        Since:
        0.9

      • isMemberOfGroup

        boolean isMemberOfGroup(String hrefOrName)
        Returns true if the account belongs to a group whose name or href is (case insensitive) equal to the specified hrefOrName value, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        hrefOrName - the href or name of the group being sought.
        Returns:
        true if the account belongs to a group whose name or href is (case insensitive) equal to the specified hrefOrName value, false otherwise.
        Since:
        0.9.3

      • getProviderData

        ProviderData getProviderData()
        Returns the ProviderData Resource belonging to the account.
        Returns:
        the ProviderData Resource belonging to the account.
        Since:
        1.0.beta

      • getApiKeys

        ApiKeyList getApiKeys()
        Returns all ApiKeys that belong to this account. The account can use any of these ApiKeys (that are enabled) to communicate with your Application's API (e.g. REST API). See application.authenticateApiRequest(request) and application.authenticateOauthRequest(request) for more information.
        Returns:
        all ApiKeys that belong to this account.
        Since:
        1.0.RC

      • getApiKeys

        ApiKeyList getApiKeys(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
        Returns a paginated list of the account's api keys that match the specified query criteria. The account can use any of these ApiKeys (that are enabled) to communicate with your Application's API (e.g. REST API). See application.authenticateApiRequest(request) and application.authenticateOauthRequest(request) for more information.

        This method is mostly provided as a non-type-safe alternative to the getApiKeys(com.stormpath.sdk.api.ApiKeyCriteria) method which might be useful in dynamic languages on the JVM (for example, with Groovy): 

         def apiKeys = account.getApiKeys([expand: 'tenant'])
        The query parameter names and values must be equal to those documented in the Stormpath REST API product guide.

        Each queryParams key/value pair will be converted to String name to String value pairs and appended to the resource URL as query parameters, for example: 

         .../accounts/accountId/apiKeys?param1=value1¶m2=value2&...

        If in doubt, use getApiKeys(com.stormpath.sdk.api.ApiKeyCriteria) as all possible query options are available via type-safe guarantees that can be auto-completed by most IDEs.
        Parameters:
        queryParams - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the account's api keys that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        1.0.RC

      • getApiKeys

        ApiKeyList getApiKeys(ApiKeyCriteria criteria)
        Returns a paginated list of the account's api keys that match the specified query criteria. The ApiKeys utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL - most modern IDEs can auto-suggest and auto-complete as you type, allowing for an easy query-building experience. For example: 
         account.getApiKeys(ApiKeys.criteria().offsetBy(50).withTenant());
        or, if you use static imports: 
         import static com.stormpath.sdk.api.ApiKeys.*;

 ...

 account.getApiKeys(criteria().offsetBy(50).withTenant());
        Parameters:
        criteria - the criteria to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the account's api keys that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        1.0.RC

      • createApiKey

        ApiKey createApiKey()
        Creates a new ApiKey assigned to this account in the Stormpath server and returns the created resource. The account can then use the ApiKey to communicate with your Application's API (e.g. REST API). See application.authenticateApiRequest(request) and application.authenticateOauthRequest(request) for more information.

        Security Notice

        The returned ApiKey's secret is considered extremely sensitive. Stormpath strongly recommends that you make newly generated ApiKeys accessible to your accounts via a File download that stays secure on their file system.

        Returns:
        the newly created ApiKey.
        Since:
        1.0.RC

      • createApiKey

        ApiKey createApiKey(ApiKeyOptions options)
        Creates a new ApiKey assigned to this account in the Stormpath server and ensures the returned ApiKey reflects the specified ApiKeyOptions. The account can then use the ApiKey to communicate with your Application's API (e.g. REST API). See application.authenticateApiRequest(request) and application.authenticateOauthRequest(request) for more information.

        Security Notice

        The returned ApiKey's secret is considered extremely sensitive. Stormpath strongly recommends that you make newly generated ApiKeys accessible to your accounts via a File download that stays secure on their file system.

        Parameters:
        options - The ApiKeyOptions to use to customize the ApiKey resource returned in the create response.
        Since:
        1.0.RC

      • getApplications

        ApplicationList getApplications()
        Returns a paginated list of the applications that the account may login to. You may control which accounts may log in to specific applications by managing an application's mapped AccountStores.

        Tip: Instead of iterating over all applications, it might be more convenient (and practical) to execute a search for one or more applications using the getApplications(ApplicationCriteria) method instead of this one.

        Returns:
        a paginated list of all of the Account's Application resources.
        Since:
        1.0.RC4
        See Also:
        getApplications(com.stormpath.sdk.application.ApplicationCriteria), getApplications(java.util.Map), Application.getAccountStoreMappings(), Application.addAccountStore(com.stormpath.sdk.directory.AccountStore)

      • getApplications

        ApplicationList getApplications(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
        Returns a paginated list of the applications that the account may login to that match the specified query criteria. You may control which accounts may log in to specific applications by managing an application's mapped AccountStores.

        Each queryParams key/value pair will be converted to String name to String value pairs and appended to the resource URL as query parameters, for example: 

         .../accounts/accountId/applications?param1=value1&param2=value2&...
        Parameters:
        queryParams - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Account's applications that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        1.0.RC4
        See Also:
        Application.getAccountStoreMappings(), Application.addAccountStore(com.stormpath.sdk.directory.AccountStore)

      • getApplications

        ApplicationList getApplications(ApplicationCriteria criteria)
        Returns a paginated list of the applications that the account may login to that match the specified query criteria. The Applications utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL. For example: 
         account.getApplications(Applications
     .where(Applications.description().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
     .and(Applications.name().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderByName().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        Parameters:
        criteria - the the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Account's applications that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        1.0.RC4
        See Also:
        Application.getAccountStoreMappings(), Application.addAccountStore(com.stormpath.sdk.directory.AccountStore)

      • getAccessTokens

        AccessTokenList getAccessTokens()
        Returns a paginated list of all the active access tokens that belong to the account.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of all the Account's active access tokens.
        Since:
        1.0.RC7

      • getRefreshTokens

        RefreshTokenList getRefreshTokens()
        Returns a paginated list of the refresh tokens that belong to the account.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Account's refresh tokens.
        Since:
        1.0.RC7
